intro: Memecylon giganteum, commonly known as the giant memecylon, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often革质 (leathery) in texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round berries. It is typically found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
